alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Greeley; Logan; Sherman; Wallace; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 18 at 3:10PM CDT until May 19 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Critical fire weather conditions expected Thursday... .Record and near record high temperatures will combine with dry southwest winds gusting up to 40 mph to produce critical fire weather conditions across much of the area. Outdoor burning is highly discouraged. A cold front will move through the area from the north around or shortly after sunset causing a shift in the winds. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MDT /NOON CDT/ TO 8 PM MDT /9 PM CDT/ THURSDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 001...013...027...028...041...042...252...253 AND 254... The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM MDT /noon CDT/ to 8 PM MDT /9 PM CDT/ Thursday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Affected Area...In Colorado...Fire Weather Zone 252 Yuma... Fire Weather Zone 253 Kit Carson and Fire Weather Zone 254 Cheyenne. In Kansas...Fire Weather Zone 001 Cheyenne...Fire Weather Zone 013 Sherman...Fire Weather Zone 027 Wallace... Fire Weather Zone 028 Logan...Fire Weather Zone 041 Greeley and Fire Weather Zone 042 Wichita. * Timing...11 AM MDT through 8 PM MDT Thursday. * Winds...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 10 percent. * Temperatures...In the lower to middle 90s. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised. * Additional Information...An abrupt wind shift to the north is expected around or shortly after sunset Thursday along and north of the Kansas/Nebraska border, continuing south across the remainder of the area during the evening. Wind gusts of 30 to 40 mph are expected. First responders fighting any fires should keep in contact with the National Weather Service in Goodland regarding the timing of the wind shift, associated with a cold front.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or are imminent. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Cheyenne; Greeley; Logan; Sherman; Wallace; Wichita
